page.title: 14 PUBLIC TRANSPORT DECLINE
page.content: The survey emphasises the problems connected with the decline in public transport.72% of those asked owned cars & 76% said that car ownership was essential.87% found the bus-fares too high & most complained about the cuts in & infrequency of public transport. These are typical rural problems which affect old people most.The closure of the railway,under Beeching in 1967,was a blow to the area.This branch line linked the Otter valley to the Southern Region main line & London.It was opened in 1897 & ran up the west bank of the Otter;E.Budleigh Stn was across from Otterton.Now only a trackless embank- ment remains & the station is a house. The loss is the greater as the bus service has not been increased to compensate.Local children are bussed to Exmouth Community College & may face journeys of up to 45 minutes.
